intro: Cycnium paucidentatum, commonly known as the lesser water hemp, is a herbaceous annual plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, characterized by its climbing or trailing growth habit. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cycnium paucidentatum is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides and in wetland areas.
